P.title: Will a Formula 1 Grand Prix be hosted in a country currently under international sanctions by 2025?

Q.title: Will Ukraine achieve full military interoperability with NATO forces by 2028?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2028, Ukraine achieves full military interoperability with NATO forces as defined by the following criteria: 1. Ukraine's armed forces must be fully integrated into NATO command structures, allowing for joint operations and decision-making. 2. Ukraine must have adopted NATO standards for military equipment, logistics, and operational procedures, as verified by NATO assessments. 3. Joint military exercises involving NATO and Ukrainian forces must demonstrate the capability to operate seamlessly together in a range of scenarios. 4. P.title: Will the US Senate pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the United States Senate has passed legislation that significantly alters or establishes new nuclear safety standards. Significant legislation is defined as any bill that: 
- Introduces new safety regulations for nuclear power plants, including but not limited to operational, environmental, or safety protocols. 
- Amends existing laws such as the Atomic Energy Act or the Nuclear Waste Policy Act in a way that enhances safety standards. 
The legislation must be officially signed into law by the President of the United States. The resolution will rely on official congressional records and reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, New York Times, Washington Post) for verification. If multiple bills are introduced, at least one must be passed and signed into law for the resolution to be Yes.

Q.title: Will any US state implement stricter nuclear safety regulations than federal standards by 2025?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, any U.S. state has enacted nuclear safety regulations that are stricter than the current federal standards set by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC). The regulations must be officially adopted and published in the state’s legislative records. The criteria for 'stricter' include any regulations that impose more rigorous safety requirements, limits, or protocols than those outlined in the federal regulations. The resolution will be based on official state government announcements, and the regulations must be in effect, not just proposed. In the case of multiple states adopting such regulations, the question will still resolve as Yes if at least one state meets the criteria.
